Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh hey, Kevin, nice of you to join us, where were you?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: My tire blew out on the way here, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I almost died. I... I went into this skid--

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pop quiz.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: ...What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Why is today a special day?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I almost died.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Today's a special day, because I am being honored as a... visiting... professor, special lecturer, emeritus... how did you, how did you...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: You will be a guest speaker... in my Emerging Enterprises class.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In business school, Kevin. Business school.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: If you bring your boss to class, it automatically bumps you up a full letter grade. So... I'd be stupid not to do it, right?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A boss is like a teacher. And I am like the cool teacher. Like Mr. Handell. Mr. Handell would hang out with us, and he would tell us awesome jokes. And he actually hooked up with one of the students. Um... and then like twelve other kids came forward. It was in all the papers. ... Really ruined eighth grade for us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Here we go. College Roadshow. Gotta bring our... A game. What was the most inspiring thing I've ever said to you?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: "Don't be an idiot." Changed my life.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Whenever I'm about to do something, I think, "Would an idiot do that?" And if they would, I do not do that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Will they throw their hats, you think?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A lot of times, at a... school, or naval academy, after a rousing speech, the crowd would throw its hats high into the air.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Y-You understand nobody's graduating.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I know, I know. I'm just saying if they did throw their hats I've got a great line for that: "May your hats fly as high as your dreams." ... That was a pretty good line.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: ...It doesn't apply.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I understand! Wow. Relax, spazzy boy. Sometimes you're such a little spaz! [pokes Ryan] Whoa, hey!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Quit it!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We have fun.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I can't for your art show tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, just so you know, it's just the students from my class in a little studio.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: I-I wouldn't miss it for the world.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm really happy to be back with Roy. I think it shows maturity. Maturity and dignity. ... Is that braggy? I don't mean it to be braggy.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Love ya.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You too.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam's with Roy. I'm with Karen. And, uh, Brangelina is with Frangelina. Movin' on.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I can't believe you're back together with Roy!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah! We have such a solid foundation, you know.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God. You're so in love now.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah. Oh, you should come to my art show, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh, art show!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I mean, it's not a big deal, but I think a lot of people from the office will be there.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: ...Oh... yeah. Definitely... I'll be there. For sure.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Campus. Brings back so many memories. ... That I would have made. Hey. Frisbee. Check that out. Aww! What do you say we get our Fris on before class? [runs over, throws frisbee] Whoo!

Quote.Speaker: College Student
Quote.Text: ....Dude.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...Oh my God. Animal stool. [jumps on desk]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dwight, what are you doing?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Solving a mystery, if that's quite alright with you. [opens ceiling tile] Come to Papa. Okay, ladies and gentlemen, what we have here is a bird that has been trapped in a vent. Fortunately I have found it befo-BAT! BAAAT! BAT!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: BAAAAT! BAT! NO! EVERYONE REMAIN CALM! There it goes!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Goooood bye.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [on ground] ... Please don't let that stupid thing near me...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, this is it. Ryan is doing my intro right now.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: ...Dunder-Mifflin can't compete with the modern chains, and management is unwilling, or unable, to adapt. Their customers are dying off...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I can't hear what he's saying, but he looks like he's really into it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We have... a bat... in the office.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: The simple solution would be to open a window... if we had... windows that could open.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Poop is raining from the ceilings. Poop!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. Thanks. [hangs up phone] Animal control will be here at six.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: At Six?! No, that is unacceptable. Okay, Jim, you are the number two in this office. You need to step up and show some leadership.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry what did you say? So wierd...

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What? What's so wierd?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The bat, I mean, I know I felt it bite me, but look. There's no mark. I feel so... tingly... so strangely powerful... [shrugs] Oh well.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: And now, without further ado, I present the regional manager of Dunder Mifflin, Scranton, Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hello everyone, I am Michael Scott. And I would like to start today by inspiring you. May I borrow someone's textbook, please? Thank you. What have we here? Ooh. Economics. Very, very interesting. [rips pages out of book] You cannot learn from books. Replace these pages with life lessons, and then, you will have... a book... that is worth its weight in gold. [gives book back] I know these are expensive, um, but the lesson is priceless. Good. Alright. I think you're inspired. Shall we proceed? There are four kinds of business: Tourism. Food service. Railroads, and sales. And hospitals slash manufacturing. And air travel.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [sighs] This is your job, Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Oh, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That bread on your desk? I just picked it up. It's white hot.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: But Jim, this garlic bread is cold.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What? ... No. It burned me. I... bizarre.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No... no. One crisis at a time.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: If a vampire bat was in the U.S., it would make sense for it to come to a "sylvania." Like PENN-sylvania. Now that doesn't mean that Jim is going to become a vampire. Only that he carries the vampiric germ.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, you wanna start a business. How do you start? What do you need? Well, first of all, you need a building. And secondly, you need supply. You need something to sell. Now this could be anything. It could be... a... thingamajig. Or a... a whosi-whatsi. Or... [pulls out a candy bar] a Whatchamacallit [throws bar]. Now, you need to sell those in order to have a PayDay [takes out a PayDay, throws it]. And, if you sell enough of them, you will make a 100 Grand [throws 100 Grand bar]. [pulls out a Snickers] Satisfied?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, this looks great. I'd, I'd love to be there, but my daughter's play is tonight. ... Damnit! You know, one of the other parents will probably videotape it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh! No, you should go.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well, it's important to support local art, you know. And what they do is not art.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, I'm seeing some confused... faces out there. Let me slow down a little bit. Break this down. Okay. The more stickers you sell, the more profit, fancy word for money, you have to buy PlayStations and Beanie Babies.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...And products!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What we normally do here is more of a question and answer thing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well... okay, I was just kind of getting it going. Um, alright. Well, okay, we can do questions. Okay. Very good. First hand up.

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #1
Quote.Text: Sir, as a company that primary distributes paper, how have you adapted your business model to function in an increasingly paperless world?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We can't overestimate the value of computers. Yes, they are great for playing games and forwarding funny emails. But real business is done on paper, okay? Write that down. [everyone types on their laptops]

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: Hey Jim, here's the aspirin you wanted.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, thank God. I have such a headache from that glare.

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: What glare?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: The glare off Angela's crucifix? It's blinding.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I don't have a lot of experience with vampires, but I have hunted werewolves. I shot one once. But by the time I got to it, it had turned back into my neighbor's dog.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Extraordinary events call for extraordinary actions. We form an allegiance-

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Sure.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: -to use sudden violence.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Do you have the tools to turn a wooden mop handle into a stake?

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What size?

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #2
Quote.Text: What do you say to a customer who wants to leave you for the convenience and savings of a nationwide chain?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...I say you will miss our service, and I absolutely guarantee you'll come back.

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #2
Quote.Text: Has anyone ever come back?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...We don't want them back, 'cause they're... stupid.

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #3
Quote.Text: How far has your Herfindahl index declined since the merger?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Nice try, how's your Pollack-says-what index?

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #3
Quote.Text: ...What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thanks, Kowalsky. Um, can we get on track here?

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #1
Quote.Text: By your own employee's calculation you'll be obsolete in the next five to ten years.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Wait, Ryan said that?

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What are you doing? You'd better not hurt that little bat.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Animals can't feel pain.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Don't hurt that bat, Creed! It's a living thing with feelings and a family!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Flush him towards the door. On my go... NOW!

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: AHH! KILL IT! KILL IT! KILL IIIT!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [locks bat in break room] I... am a hero!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah sure, you know business, sitting up here in your ivory tower. And your ebony tower. You know what? Tell you one thing, Dunder-Mifflin is here to stay.

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #2
Quote.Text: But how can you compete against a company with the resources of a nationwide chain?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David will always beat Goliath.

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #1
Quote.Text: But there's five Goliaths, there's... Staples, Officemax...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, yeah. You know what else is facing five Goliaths? America. Al-Qaeda, global warming, sex predators... mercury poisoning. So do we just give up? Is that what we're learning in business school?

Quote.Speaker: Business Student #1
Quote.Text: But in the big picture...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dunder-Mifflin is the big picture! Can't you understand that? No, you can't. You're too young. Ryan... has never made a sale. And he started a fire trying to make a cheesy pita. And everybody thinks he's a tease. Well you know what? He doesn't know anything, and neither do you. [walks out] SO SUCK ON THAT!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: ...It wasn't personal.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Business is always personal. It's the most personal thing in the world. When we get back to the office, pack your things.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Pack my-?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You heard me, pack your things.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: I really want to come out!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Good night, Mary Beth!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So... you're cool to just wait here for animal control?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Animal control? I've been controlling animals since I was six.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Cool. Okay. I'm gonna go home and lie down, draw the shades... there's just so much sun in here... bye Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Goodbye Jim. And good luck.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Jim is on a path now. An eternal journey, and I wish him well. But I have a destiny in this realm. Specifically, in the kitchen.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: ...And it's all from the same series.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Called 'Impressions.'

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Not that I call myself an impressionist, per se.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Maybe one day.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I hope so.

Quote.Speaker: Woman
Quote.Text: Mmm.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I still need... you know, my breakthrough, or whatever. [Woman leaves, Roy enters] Hey, babe, how are you?

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Good. Alright I brought my brother, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Kenny.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: Hey Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: How 'bout this, huh? I show up with my brother, and, no one from work is here? That's... pretty cool, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Magic time. Gyeeeaahhh! [puts bag over Meredith's head]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ahh! Ahh! Ahh! Get off! Get off me! Get off me!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hold still, woman!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Get off me! Get it off! Ahhhh!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ...[captures bat in bag] ... You're welcome.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: It's cool if I go, right? I mean, I looked at all of them.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I'll just, I'll drive myself home.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: To my place?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Maybe, I'm a little tired.

Quote.Speaker: Roy
Quote.Text: Your art.. was the prettiest art of... all art.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Look, I'm sorry, okay? I was just trying to do my presentation, and... of course, I was wrong to suggest that Dunder-Mifflin might ever go out of business. But you don't have to fire me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fire you? No, no no. You are moving... to the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: To the annex? Where... Kelly is?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A good manager doesn't fire people. He hires people and inspires people. ... People, Ryan. And people will never go out of business.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're the one who said we needed more culture.

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: This is culture to you?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's her first try.

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: Yeah, on Van Gogh's first try, he drew the hands of the peasants.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Meaning what?

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: Meaning, real art takes courage, okay? And honesty.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, those aren't Pam's strong points.

Quote.Speaker: Gil
Quote.Text: Yeah, exactly. That's why this is... motel art.

Quote.Speaker: Artist
Quote.Text: Thanks for coming.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Pam-casso! Sorry I'm late, I had to race across town.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! You did these... freehand?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yep.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: My God, these could be tracings! Ohh! Look at this one. Wow! You nailed it. [sighs] ... How much?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What do you mean?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't see a... price.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Um... you wanna buy it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, yeah. Yeah, we have to have it for the office. I mean, there's my... window, and there's my car! That your car?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh-huh.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That is our building... and we sell paper. ... I am really proud of you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [hugs Michael] ... Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Do you have something in your pocket?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: ...Chunky. Do you want half?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It is... a message. It is an inspiration, it is... a source of beauty. And without paper, it could not have happened. Unless, you had a camera.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God, oh my God...

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's only temporary, okay? Don't get excited.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't, I won't...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well ultimately I went into business to inspire people. They say those who can't do, teach. I can do both. I teach doing.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: OK, here we go... Digest of business terms, CliffsNotes on business economics, and a sales encyclopedia.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Wow! That's a lot of books, do you have, umm, one book that sums up all of these.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Those are the books that sum up the other books.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So no?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What are you reading?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, umm, ever since I started here, I've kept a diary of all my sales.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, that could be interesting.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, it's just mileage mostly, but there's one chapter that I call wisdoms. I'm going to read you a series of statements, and I want you to tell me, on a scale of one to ten, how smart they are.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [clears throat] I am ready.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Don't do what I say, say what I do.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Five.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just getting warmed up. Mistakes are just successes that you mess up.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hmm... Five.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This... You know this is a scale of one to ten?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: OK. Do you want me to repeat that?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I got it.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: [motions to phyllis's desk]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: She's on her honeymoon. She won't be back for six weeks.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: I'll wait. [sighs]

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Here's a joke for you. Why did Pam hook up with Roy at Phyllis's wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Don't Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: You ready?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You know I don't like to participate in the...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why did Pam hook up with Roy at Phyllis's wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Really, it's just that I don't like to participate...

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Grow up.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: It's just... I'm sorry... It's gossip, and I don't think it's healthy.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Get over yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not going to get over myself... it's wrong.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Because Roy use to... [long censor beep]... with the rice... [long censor beep]... [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [laughs] That's disgusting.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [still laughing] I know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Everybody please stand, and get up on your desks. [goes to stand on desk] Just stand right up.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Michael it's not... It's not...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That's, yep a little flimsy. Umm... OK... Ahh... Alright, no more desks. Oh OK.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I have a lot of big ideas, and the trick is to get it out of my brain and into theirs, in a way that is easy to swallow. Simple... [holds up snickers] Kids love candy bars.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Lets try a little... Little social experiment here. Raise your hands if you like to buy things. OK, I see some people who like to buy things. You're it, you are the reason this world rolls along, give yourselves a round of applause. Say, say you want to start a business, and business is all about buying and selling, is it not? So say you want to sell lemonade, or stickers. Something you have to keep in mind, you must, and you might want to jot this down, you must sell the stickers for more than you bought the stickers for.

Quote.Speaker: Student 1
Quote.Text: How have you adopted your business model to function in an increasingly paperless world?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, Oh, I take umbrage to that premise...ses. Umm, let me ask you this:

Quote.Speaker: Karen
Quote.Text: [Karen sees Pam's art show flyer on the cabinet door, she looks around to make sure no one is looking, then proceeds to rip in down, Oscar comes out of the bathroom, Karen acts like she was just looking at it and then walks out of the kitchen]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: BAT!

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [comes out of the bathroom... screams... runs back into the bathroom]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What is a leader? I asked Jim that, and he said he had never heard the word before. In America, in 2007. He said he knew the word ladder... What an ignoramous.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: [Bat hanging from ceiling cleaning itself] I really want to come out.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You want rabies? Be my guest.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [looking with Kevin at the art show flyer] Should be fun.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Your name looks really nice.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Goodnight Mary-Beth.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hope she's OK.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Just goes to show the power of prayer.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: You prayed for this?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: In a general sense.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: So cool you're back with Roy. Maybe we can rent that cabin on the lake again this summer.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, that'd be nice.

Quote.Speaker: Kenny
Quote.Text: There'll be two of you and only one of me this time, since Denise left me. So I think it's fair I only pay a third.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah that seems fair.
